title: SPICA Delivers a K-Pop Cover of Anna Kendrick’s ‘Cups’: Watch – Billboard
text:
K-pop girl group SPICA sing, rap and harmonize in English and Korean in a cover of Anna Kendrick's "Cups (When I'm Gone)" hit. By
												

	Jeff Benjamin Rookie K-pop girl group SPICA have unveiled a Korean-English cover of Anna Kendrick‘s Top 10 Hot 100 hit, “Cups (Pitch Perfect’s When I’m Gone).” In the 1:43 video, the five members of SPICA sing, rap and harmonize in English and Korean acappella. All the while they perform the same hand clap/cup routine seen in the “Pitch Perfect” film and music video. SPICA’s singles like “Potently,” “I’ll Be There” and “Painkiller” (the last which was named one of Billboard’s Top 20 K-Pop Songs of 2012) have hovered around the Top 40, 50 or 60s of the K-Pop Hot 100. Kendrick’s “Cups” is at No. 10 with a bullet on the Billboard Hot 100 after 29 weeks on the chart.
